snippet: A survey of writers in democratic and nondemocratic countries showed that a majority considered freedom of expression to be under significant threat.
abstract: Survey of writers around world by the PEN American Center finds that significant majority say they are deeply concerned with government surveillance and that it has affected their willingness to address controversial topics in writing; results show that writers consider freedom of expression to be under threat around world in both democratic and nondemocratic countries.
lead_paragraph: A survey of writers in democratic and nondemocratic countries showed that a majority considered freedom of expression to be under significant threat.

headline.main: Writers Say They Feel Censored by Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Writers Say They Feel Censored by Surveillance
